full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/18/2023 -11- Q Which side of your home vilege is considered the head of the village? A. The north. Q The applicant states that the south side is the head of the village. HOW about that? A. The north side is the head of the village as far as I know. Maybe he got it mixed up. Q Are any of the houses in your village joined together, or are they all separated by a space? A. No, (changes) the two houses in each row are joined together. Q Is there a photograph of yourself in your home in China? A. No. Q Can you see any neighboring villages from your home village? A. Yes, the TONG BIN Vil. Q Can you see any other village? A. No. Q Can't you see the PING YONGVillage? A. Yes, dimly. Q Do you now own any land in China? A. Yes, I have 6 or 7 mow. Q Where is it located? A. Right close by our village in front. Q What is it used for? A. Rice growing. Do you recognize this photograph (referring to photo of WONG KWOCK FAY on affidavit of WONG SICK HONG dated 5/31/28 in San Francisco file 27487/8-25)? A. Yes, that is WONG GOK FAY. Q Do you recognize this photograph (referring to photo of WONG KWOCK DOON on affidavit of WONG SICK HONG dated 4/20/29 in SanPedro file 30160/1)1 A. Yes, that is my son WONG DOK DOON. Q Do yourecognize this photograph (referring to photo of WONG KWOCK HAI on affidavit of WONG SICK HONG dated 4/20/29 in San Pedro file 30160/129)? A. Yes, that is WONG GOK HAI. Q Why didn't your two alleged som KWOCK DOON and KWOCK HAI come to the United States t√¥gether in 1929, it, being noted that you prepared your affidavits for both of them on the dame day? A. Because my son GOK DOON wanted to finish out his schooling in PING YONG Vil. that year. Q But GOK DOON came before - six months before - KWOCK HAI came? A. I got my sons mixed. I was thinking of GOK DOON and GOK FAY when I said GOK DOON wanted to finish out his school ing PING YONGMIL As I think of it now, I think it was due to some illness of my wife that one of them had to stay and delay coming. Q How long was your wife ill, and what was the nature of her illness? A. It was not a serious illness, shewis in poor health; she had influenza. I don't know how long she was ill. a Did KWOCK HAI tell you when he arrived here in February, 1930 that that was the reason he did not accompany GOK DOON in July, 1929? A. Yes. Q After this Board has taken the testimony of your alleged son KWOCK HAI, are you willing for it to proceed to a decision in this case without considering further evidence of any kind? A. Yes. Q Have you any further statement to make or evidence to offer in his behalf? A. No. Q Have you understood the interpreter? A. Yes. Q Any further questions by members of the Board? A. By both members: No. Witness excused. 7402/99 -11- 11/7/32
